geometr 0.2.7

Sketch geoms

Source: R/gt_sketch.R
gt_sketch.Rd

Sketch geoms by clicking into a plot.

gt_sketch(
  template = NULL,
  shape = NULL,
  features = 1,
  vertices = NULL,
  regular = FALSE,
  fixed = FALSE,
  show = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

template

[gridded object(1)]
a gridded object that serves as template to sketch the geometry.
shape

[character(1)]
the shape that should be sketched, options are the geometry shapes "point", "line" and "polygon" and special cases thereof (recently implemented are "triangle", "square", "hexagon") and "random".
features

[integerish(1)]
number of geometries to create.
vertices

[integerish(.)]
number of vertices per geometry; will be recycled if it does not have as many elements as specified in features.
regular

[logical(1)]
in case a polygon is sketched, should it be regular, i.e. point symmetric (TRUE) with the number of corners defined by vertices or should the vertices be selected according to the click locations, resulting in a non-regular polygon (FALSE, default)?
fixed

[logical(1)]
in case a regular polygon is sketched, should it be aligned vertically (TRUE, default), or should it be aligned according to the second click (FALSE); only relevant if regular = TRUE.
show

[logical(1)]
should information be shown in the plot (TRUE), or should the geom merely be returned (FALSE, default)
...

[various]
additional arguments to gt_locate.

Value

An invisible geom.

See also

Other geometry tools: gt_filter(), gt_locate(), gt_pull(), gt_reflect(), gt_rotate(), gt_scale(), gt_skew(), gt_stretch(), gt_translate()

Examples

# \donttest{
# sketch a point geometry
gt_sketch(template = gtRasters$categorical, shape = "point", show = TRUE)

#> please click 1 vertices.

# sketch a line geometry
gt_sketch(template = gtRasters$categorical, vertices = 4, shape = "line") %>%
  visualise(points = ., linecol = "orange", linewidth = 5, new = FALSE)

#> please click 4 vertices.
#> Error in if (min(input$x) != min(window$x)) {    window$x[window$x %in% min(window$x)] <- min(input$x)}: missing value where TRUE/FALSE needed

# sketch a polygon geometry
gt_sketch(template = gtRasters$continuous, shape = "hexagon") %>%
  visualise(geom = ., linecol = "deeppink", linetype = 2, new = FALSE)

#> please click the polygons' center and first vertex.
#> Error in if (min(input$x) != min(window$x)) {    window$x[window$x %in% min(window$x)] <- min(input$x)}: missing value where TRUE/FALSE needed
# }
